channel.title: Why Create Functions? :: Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: After wading through all of the new syntax necessary to create a function, you might be asking yourself, Why would I ever want to do this? Good question! We have a few answers. Functions Reduce Repetition Like loops, functions help us keep our code DRY. When we need to repeat the same basic task in multiple parts of a program, a function will allow us to package up that task into a neat, reusable form. Loops enable the same task to be repeated many times in succession, while functions enable the same task to be repeated in different portions of a program.
